page.title: 04FARMING-NEWTON OF COLLESSIE
page.content: It is common in this area for farmers to keep both cattle and sheep.Mr Black of Newton of Collessie has a total of 300 heifers and freisians. He does not have a dairy unit but provides the calves for elsewhere.The introduction of milk quotas in 1983 (when production was cut by 10% on the previous years figures) not only affected dairy farms but others like this one. 100{SUFFOLK}sheep are also on this farm. They are part of the farmer's livelihood but also a hobby. This breed is easily shepherded and a good meat producer, providing some 75-80% of all home produced lamb and mutton. There are 30 breeders in Fife and Mr Black has had the champion Suffolk and supreme sheep in the local agricultural shows. A top class lamb can fetch up to Â£8000.
